titleStmt.title: The shame and humiliation of the Quakers in a remarkable judgment of [...]tuation, already begun upon some of [...]stinate ministers of their second days meeting. With a fair warning and kind admonition to the rest, who are sincere, and desire to escape the snare of deceit, to beware of them. 1. A brief account of the beginning and progress of the difference between George Keith and the other Quakers, and of their meeting at Turners-Hall, April 29, 1697.
titleStmt.author: Stephens, Edward, d. 1706.

publicationStmt.publisher: sold by D. Brown, at the Black Swan and Bible without Temple-Bar and R. Smith, at the Angel without Linco[l]ns Inn-Gate, near the Fields,

notesStmt.note: Advertisement at the foot of p.8.
Imperfect; text on title page is obscured by the British Library property stamp.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: the Angel without Linco[l]ns Inn-Gate, near the Fields
